meanings.definition: Commissioner: a person appointed or elected to a position of authority
meanings.sent1: The commish oversaw the city council meeting.
meanings.sent2: The commish made important decisions for the community.
meanings.sent3: The commish tried to wear a superhero cape to work one day.
meanings.sent4: The commish was like a wise owl, watching over the town.
meanings.sent5: The commish's presence commanded respect in the room.

meanings.definition: Commission: a fee paid to an agent for services rendered
meanings.sent1: She paid a commish to the real estate agent for finding her a house.
meanings.sent2: The commish for the service was included in the final bill.
meanings.sent3: The commish to the detective was a bag of gummy bears.
meanings.sent4: The commish felt like a weight lifted off her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The commish was a token of appreciation for a job well done.

meanings.definition: Commission: to give an order for or authorize the production of something
meanings.sent1: The company commished a new logo design for their website.
meanings.sent2: She commished a custom-made dress for the special occasion.
meanings.sent3: He commished a giant ice cream sundae just for fun.
meanings.sent4: The artist commished a mural to brighten up the neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: They commished a song to celebrate their friendship.
